aristaBgp4V2.name: aristaBgp4V2

revisions.description: Renumbered inside the Arista enterprise space.
This MIB updates and replaces the BGP MIB defined in RFC 4273.

aristaBgp4V2.contactinfo: Arista Networks, Inc. Postal: 5453 Great America Parkway Santa Clara, CA 95054 Tel: +1 408 547-5500 E-mail: snmp@arista.com
aristaBgp4V2.description: The MIB module for the BGP-4 protocol. This version was published in draft-ietf-idr-bgp4-mibv2-13, and modified to be homed inside the Arista enterprise. There were no other modifications. Copyright (C) The IETF Trust (2012). This version of this MIB module is part of draft-ietf-idr-bgp4-mibv2-13.txt; see the draft itself for full legal notices.

aristaBgp4V2DiscontinuityTable.name: aristaBgp4V2DiscontinuityTable
aristaBgp4V2DiscontinuityTable.description: Table of BGP-4 discontinuities. Discontinuities that have external visibility occur on a per-BGP instance basis. Transitions by a given BGP peer will result in a consistent BGP view within that instance and thus do not represent a discontinuity from a protocol standpoint.

aristaBgp4V2DiscontinuityEntry.name: aristaBgp4V2DiscontinuityEntry
aristaBgp4V2DiscontinuityEntry.description: Entry repsenting information about a discontinuity event for a given BGP instance.

aristaBgp4V2DiscontinuityTime.name: aristaBgp4V2DiscontinuityTime
aristaBgp4V2DiscontinuityTime.description: The value of sysUpTime at the most recent occasion at which this BGP management instance has suffered a discontinuity.

aristaBgp4V2PeerTable.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerTable
aristaBgp4V2PeerTable.description: BGP peer table. This table contains, one entry per BGP peer, information about the connections with BGP peers.

aristaBgp4V2PeerEntry.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerEntry
aristaBgp4V2PeerEntry.description: Entry containing information about the connection with a remote BGP peer.

aristaBgp4V2PeerInstance.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerInstance
aristaBgp4V2PeerInstance.description: The routing instance index. Some BGP implementations permit the creation of multiple instances of a BGP routing process. An example includes routers running BGP/MPLS IP Virtual Private Networks. Implementations that do not support multiple routing instances should return 1 for this object.

aristaBgp4V2PeerLocalAddrType.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerLocalAddrType
aristaBgp4V2PeerLocalAddrType.description: The address family of the local end of the peering session.

aristaBgp4V2PeerLocalAddr.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerLocalAddr
aristaBgp4V2PeerLocalAddr.description: The local IP address of this entry's BGP connection. An implementation is required to support IPv4 peering sessions in which case the length of this object is 4. An implementation MAY support IPv6 peering sessions in which case the length of this object is 16. IPv6 link-local peering sessions MAY be supported by this MIB. In this case the length of this object is 20.

aristaBgp4V2PeerRemoteAddrType.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerRemoteAddrType
aristaBgp4V2PeerRemoteAddrType.description: The address family of the remote end of the peering session. An implementation is required to support IPv4 peering sessions in which case the length of this object is 4. An implementation MAY support IPv6 peering sessions in which case the length of this object is 16. IPv6 link-local peering sessions MAY be supported by this MIB. In this case the length of this object is 20.

aristaBgp4V2PeerRemoteAddr.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerRemoteAddr
aristaBgp4V2PeerRemoteAddr.description: The remote IP address of this entry's BGP peer.

aristaBgp4V2PeerLocalPort.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerLocalPort
aristaBgp4V2PeerLocalPort.description: The local port for the TCP connection between the BGP peers.

aristaBgp4V2PeerLocalAs.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerLocalAs
aristaBgp4V2PeerLocalAs.description: Some implementations of BGP can represent themselves as multiple ASes. This is the AS that this peering session is representing itself as to the remote peer.

aristaBgp4V2PeerLocalIdentifier.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerLocalIdentifier
aristaBgp4V2PeerLocalIdentifier.description: The BGP Identifier of the local system for this peering session. It is REQUIRED that all aristaBgp4V2PeerLocalIdentifier values for the same aristaBgp4V2PeerInstance be identical.

aristaBgp4V2PeerRemotePort.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerRemotePort
aristaBgp4V2PeerRemotePort.reference: RFC 2012 - SNMPv2 Management Information Base for the Transmission Control Protocol using SMIv2. RFC 4022 - IP Version 6 Management Information Base for the Transmission Control Protocol.
aristaBgp4V2PeerRemotePort.description: The remote port for the TCP connection between the BGP peers. Note that the objects aristaBgp4V2PeerLocalAddr, aristaBgp4V2PeerLocalPort, aristaBgp4V2PeerRemoteAddr and aristaBgp4V2PeerRemotePort provide the appropriate reference to the standard MIB TCP connection table, or even the ipv6 TCP MIB as in RFC 4022.

aristaBgp4V2PeerRemoteAs.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerRemoteAs
aristaBgp4V2PeerRemoteAs.description: The remote autonomous system number received in the BGP OPEN message.

aristaBgp4V2PeerRemoteIdentifier.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerRemoteIdentifier
aristaBgp4V2PeerRemoteIdentifier.description: The BGP Identifier of this entry's remote BGP peer. This entry should be 0.0.0.0 unless the aristaBgp4V2PeerState is in the openconfirm or the established state.

aristaBgp4V2PeerAdminStatus.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerAdminStatus
aristaBgp4V2PeerAdminStatus.description: Whether or not the BGP FSM for this remote peer is halted or running. The BGP FSM for a remote peer is halted after processing a Stop event. Likewise, it is in the running state after a Start event. The aristaBgp4V2PeerState will generally be in the idle state when the FSM is halted, although some extensions such as Graceful Restart will leave the peer in the Idle state but with the FSM running.

aristaBgp4V2PeerDescription.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerDescription
aristaBgp4V2PeerDescription.description: A user configured description identifying this peer. When this object is not the empty string, this object SHOULD contain a description that is unique within a given BGP instance for this peer.

aristaBgp4V2PeerErrorsTable.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerErrorsTable
aristaBgp4V2PeerErrorsTable.description: On a per-peer basis, this table reflects the last protocol-defined error encountered and reported on the peer session.

aristaBgp4V2PeerErrorsEntry.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerErrorsEntry
aristaBgp4V2PeerErrorsEntry.description: Each entry contains information about errors sent and received for a particular BGP peer.

aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorCodeReceived.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorCodeReceived
aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorCodeReceived.reference: RFC 4271, Section 4.5. RFC 4486 optionally supported. RFC 3362, Section 5 optionally supported.
aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorCodeReceived.description: The last error code received from this peer via NOTIFICATION message on this connection. If no error has occurred, this field is zero.

aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorSubCodeReceived.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorSubCodeReceived
aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorSubCodeReceived.reference: RFC 4271, Section 4.5. RFC 4486 optionally supported. RFC 3362, Section 5 optionally supported.
aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorSubCodeReceived.description: The last subcode received from this peer via NOTIFICATION message on this connection. If no error has occurred, this field is zero.

aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorReceivedTime.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorReceivedTime
aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorReceivedTime.description: The timestamp that the last NOTIFICATION was received from this peer.

aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorReceivedText.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorReceivedText
aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorReceivedText.description: This object contains an implementation specific explanation of the error that was reported.

aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorReceivedData.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorReceivedData
aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorReceivedData.reference: RFC 4271, Section 4.5, RFC 2578, Section 7.1.2, RFC 4486 optionally supported. RFC 3362, Section 5 optionally supported.
aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorReceivedData.description: The last error code's data seen by this peer. Per RFC 2578, some implementations may have limitations dealing with OCTET STRINGS larger than 255. Thus, this data may be truncated.

aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorCodeSent.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorCodeSent
aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorCodeSent.reference: RFC 4271, Section 4.5. RFC 4486 optionally supported. RFC 3362, Section 5 optionally supported.
aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorCodeSent.description: The last error code sent to this peer via NOTIFICATION message on this connection. If no error has occurred, this field is zero.

aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorSubCodeSent.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorSubCodeSent
aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorSubCodeSent.reference: RFC 4271, Section 4.5. RFC 4486 optionally supported. RFC 3362, Section 5 optionally supported.
aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorSubCodeSent.description: The last subcode sent to this peer via NOTIFICATION message on this connection. If no error has occurred, this field is zero.

aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorSentTime.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorSentTime
aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorSentTime.description: The timestamp that the last NOTIFICATION was sent to this peer.

aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorSentText.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorSentText
aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorSentText.description: This object contains an implementation specific explanation of the error that is being reported.

aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorSentData.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorSentData
aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorSentData.reference: RFC 4271, Section 4.5, RFC 2578, Section 7.1.2 RFC 4486 optionally supported. RFC 3362, Section 5 optionally supported.
aristaBgp4V2PeerLastErrorSentData.description: The last error code's data sent to this peer. Per RFC 2578, some implementations may have limitations dealing with OCTET STRINGS larger than 255. Thus, this data may be truncated.

aristaBgp4V2PeerEventTimesTable.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerEventTimesTable
aristaBgp4V2PeerEventTimesTable.description: A table reporting the per-peering session amount of time elapsed and update events since the peering session advanced into the established state.

aristaBgp4V2PeerEventTimesEntry.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerEventTimesEntry
aristaBgp4V2PeerEventTimesEntry.description: Each row contains a set of statistics about time spent and events encountered in the peer session established state.

aristaBgp4V2PeerFsmEstablishedTime.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerFsmEstablishedTime
aristaBgp4V2PeerFsmEstablishedTime.description: This timer indicates how long (in seconds) this peer has been in the established state or how long since this peer was last in the established state. It is set to zero when a new peer is configured or when the router is booted. If the peer has never reached the established state, the value remains zero.

aristaBgp4V2PeerInUpdatesElapsedTime.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerInUpdatesElapsedTime
aristaBgp4V2PeerInUpdatesElapsedTime.reference: RFC 4271, Section 4.3. RFC 4271, Section 8.2.2, Established state.
aristaBgp4V2PeerInUpdatesElapsedTime.description: Elapsed time (in seconds) since the last BGP UPDATE message was received from the peer. Each time bgpPeerInUpdates is incremented, the value of this object is set to zero (0).

aristaBgp4V2PeerConfiguredTimersTable.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerConfiguredTimersTable
aristaBgp4V2PeerConfiguredTimersTable.description: Per peer management data on BGP session timers.

aristaBgp4V2PeerConfiguredTimersEntry.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerConfiguredTimersEntry
aristaBgp4V2PeerConfiguredTimersEntry.description: Each entry corresponds to the current state of BGP timers on a given peering session.

aristaBgp4V2PeerConnectRetryInterval.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerConnectRetryInterval
aristaBgp4V2PeerConnectRetryInterval.reference: RFC 4271, Section 8.2.2. This is the value used to initialize the 'ConnectRetryTimer'.
aristaBgp4V2PeerConnectRetryInterval.description: Time interval (in seconds) for the ConnectRetry timer. The suggested value for this timer is 120 seconds.

aristaBgp4V2PeerHoldTimeConfigured.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerHoldTimeConfigured
aristaBgp4V2PeerHoldTimeConfigured.description: Time interval (in seconds) for the Hold Timer established with the peer. The value of this object is calculated by this BGP speaker, using the smaller of the values in bgpPeerHoldTimeConfigured and the Hold Time received in the OPEN message. This value must be at least three seconds if it is not zero (0). If the Hold Timer has not been established with the peer this object MUST have a value of zero (0). If the bgpPeerHoldTimeConfigured object has a value of (0), then this object MUST have a value of (0).

aristaBgp4V2PeerKeepAliveConfigured.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerKeepAliveConfigured
aristaBgp4V2PeerKeepAliveConfigured.description: Time interval (in seconds) for the KeepAlive timer configured for this BGP speaker with this peer. The value of this object will only determine the KEEPALIVE messages' frequency relative to the value specified in bgpPeerHoldTimeConfigured; the actual time interval for the KEEPALIVE messages is indicated by bgpPeerKeepAlive. A reasonable maximum value for this timer would be one third of that of bgpPeerHoldTimeConfigured. If the value of this object is zero (0), no periodic KEEPALIVE messages are sent to the peer after the BGP connection has been established. The suggested value for this timer is 30 seconds.

aristaBgp4V2PeerMinASOrigInterval.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerMinASOrigInterval
aristaBgp4V2PeerMinASOrigInterval.description: Time interval (in seconds) for the MinASOriginationInterval timer. The suggested value for this timer is 15 seconds.

aristaBgp4V2PeerMinRouteAdverInterval.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerMinRouteAdverInterval
aristaBgp4V2PeerMinRouteAdverInterval.description: Time interval (in seconds) for the MinRouteAdvertisementInterval timer. The suggested value for this timer is 30 seconds for EBGP connections and 5 seconds for IBGP connections.

aristaBgp4V2PeerNegotiatedTimersTable.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerNegotiatedTimersTable
aristaBgp4V2PeerNegotiatedTimersTable.description: Configured values of per-peer timers are seen in the aristaBgp4V2PeerConfiguredTimersTable. Values in this table reflect the current operational values, after negotiation from values derived from initial configuration.

aristaBgp4V2PeerNegotiatedTimersEntry.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerNegotiatedTimersEntry
aristaBgp4V2PeerNegotiatedTimersEntry.description: Each entry reflects a value of the currently operational, negotiated timer as reflected in the AristaBgp4V2PeerNegotiatedTimersEntry.

aristaBgp4V2PeerHoldTime.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerHoldTime
aristaBgp4V2PeerHoldTime.description: The value of this object is calculated by this BGP Speaker as being; zero (0) - if this was the value sent by the peer and this value is permitted by this BGP Speaker. In this case, no keepalive messages are sent and the Hold Timer is not set. At least three (3). This value is the smaller of the value sent by this peer in the OPEN message and aristaBgp4V2PeerHoldTimeConfigured for this peer. If the peer is not in the established state, the value of this object is zero (0).

aristaBgp4V2PeerKeepAlive.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerKeepAlive
aristaBgp4V2PeerKeepAlive.description: Time interval in seconds for the KeepAlive timer established with the peer. The value of this object is calculated by this BGP speaker such that, when compared with aristaBgp4V2PeerHoldTime, it has the same proportion as what aristaBgp4V2PeerKeepAliveConfigured has when compared with aristaBgp4V2PeerHoldTimeConfigured. If the value of this object is zero (0), it indicates that the KeepAlive timer has not been established with the peer, or, the value of aristaBgp4V2PeerKeepAliveConfigured is zero (0). If the peer is not in the established state, the value of this object is zero (0).

aristaBgp4V2PeerCountersTable.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerCountersTable
aristaBgp4V2PeerCountersTable.description: The counters associated with a BGP Peer.

aristaBgp4V2PeerCountersEntry.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerCountersEntry
aristaBgp4V2PeerCountersEntry.description: Each entry contains counters of message transmissions and FSM transitions for a given BGP Peering session.

aristaBgp4V2PeerInUpdates.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerInUpdates
aristaBgp4V2PeerInUpdates.description: The number of BGP UPDATE messages received on this connection.

aristaBgp4V2PeerOutUpdates.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerOutUpdates
aristaBgp4V2PeerOutUpdates.description: The number of BGP UPDATE messages transmitted on this connection.

aristaBgp4V2PeerInTotalMessages.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerInTotalMessages
aristaBgp4V2PeerInTotalMessages.description: The total number of messages received from the remote peer on this connection.

aristaBgp4V2PeerOutTotalMessages.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerOutTotalMessages
aristaBgp4V2PeerOutTotalMessages.description: The total number of messages transmitted to the remote peer on this connection.

aristaBgp4V2PeerFsmEstablishedTransition.name: aristaBgp4V2PeerFsmEstablishedTransitions
aristaBgp4V2PeerFsmEstablishedTransition.description: The total number of times the BGP FSM transitioned into the established state for this peer.

aristaBgp4V2PrefixGaugesTable.name: aristaBgp4V2PrefixGaugesTable
aristaBgp4V2PrefixGaugesTable.description: Additional per-peer, per AFI-SAFI counters for prefixes

aristaBgp4V2PrefixGaugesEntry.name: aristaBgp4V2PrefixGaugesEntry
aristaBgp4V2PrefixGaugesEntry.description: Entry containing information about a bgp-peers prefix counters.

aristaBgp4V2PrefixGaugesAfi.name: aristaBgp4V2PrefixGaugesAfi
aristaBgp4V2PrefixGaugesAfi.description: The AFI index of the per-peer, per prefix counters

aristaBgp4V2PrefixGaugesSafi.name: aristaBgp4V2PrefixGaugesSafi
aristaBgp4V2PrefixGaugesSafi.description: The SAFI index of the per-peer, per prefix counters

aristaBgp4V2PrefixInPrefixes.name: aristaBgp4V2PrefixInPrefixes
aristaBgp4V2PrefixInPrefixes.description: The number of prefixes received from a peer and are stored in the Adj-Ribs-In for that peer. Note that this number does not reflect prefixes that have been discarded due to policy.

aristaBgp4V2PrefixInPrefixesAccepted.name: aristaBgp4V2PrefixInPrefixesAccepted
aristaBgp4V2PrefixInPrefixesAccepted.description: The number of prefixes for a peer that are installed in the Adj-Ribs-In and are eligible to become active in the Loc-Rib.

aristaBgp4V2PrefixOutPrefixes.name: aristaBgp4V2PrefixOutPrefixes
aristaBgp4V2PrefixOutPrefixes.description: The number of prefixes for a peer that are installed in that peer's Adj-Ribs-Out.

aristaBgp4V2NlriTable.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriTable
aristaBgp4V2NlriTable.description: The BGP-4 Received Path Attribute Table contains information about paths to destination networks received from all BGP4 peers. Collectively, this represents the Adj-Ribs-In. The route where aristaBgp4V2NlriBest is true represents, for this NLRI, the route that is installed in the LocRib from the Adj-Ribs-In.

aristaBgp4V2NlriEntry.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriEntry
aristaBgp4V2NlriEntry.description: Information about a path to a network.

aristaBgp4V2NlriIndex.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriIndex
aristaBgp4V2NlriIndex.reference: RFC 3107 - Carrying Label Information in BGP-4.
aristaBgp4V2NlriIndex.description: This index allows for multiple instances of a base prefix for a certain AFI-SAFI from a given peer. This is currently useful for two things: 1. Allowing for a peer in future implementations to send more than a single route instance. 2. Allow for extensions which extend the NLRI field to send the same prefix while utilizing other extension specific information. An example of this is RFC 3107 - Carrying MPLS labels in BGP.

aristaBgp4V2NlriAfi.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriAfi
aristaBgp4V2NlriAfi.description: The address family of the prefix for this NLRI. Note that the AFI is not necessarily equivalent to the an InetAddressType.

aristaBgp4V2NlriSafi.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriSafi
aristaBgp4V2NlriSafi.description: The subsequent address family of the prefix for this NLRI

aristaBgp4V2NlriPrefixType.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriPrefixType
aristaBgp4V2NlriPrefixType.description: The type of the IP address prefix in the Network Layer Reachability Information field. The value of this object is derived from the appropriate value from the aristaBgp4V2NlriAfi field. Where an appropriate InetAddressType is not available, the value of the object must be unknown(0).

aristaBgp4V2NlriPrefix.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriPrefix
aristaBgp4V2NlriPrefix.description: An IP address prefix in the Network Layer Reachability Information field. This object is an IP address containing the prefix with length specified by aristaBgp4V2NlriPrefixLen. Any bits beyond the length specified by aristaBgp4V2NlriPrefixLen are zeroed. An implementation is required to support IPv4 prefixes. In this case, the object length is (0..4). An implementation MAY support IPv6 prefixes. In this case, the object length is (0..16)

aristaBgp4V2NlriPrefixLen.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriPrefixLen
aristaBgp4V2NlriPrefixLen.description: Length in bits of the address prefix in the Network Layer Reachability Information field.

aristaBgp4V2NlriBest.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriBest
aristaBgp4V2NlriBest.description: An indication of whether or not this route was chosen as the best BGP4 route for this destination.

aristaBgp4V2NlriCalcLocalPref.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriCalcLocalPref
aristaBgp4V2NlriCalcLocalPref.description: The degree of preference calculated by the receiving BGP4 speaker for an advertised route. In the case where this prefix is ineligible, the value of this object will be zero (0).

aristaBgp4V2NlriOrigin.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriOrigin
aristaBgp4V2NlriOrigin.description: The ultimate origin of the path information.

aristaBgp4V2NlriNextHopAddrType.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriNextHopAddrType
aristaBgp4V2NlriNextHopAddrType.description: The address family of the address for the border router that should be used to access the destination network.

aristaBgp4V2NlriNextHopAddr.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriNextHopAddr
aristaBgp4V2NlriNextHopAddr.reference: RFC 4271, Section 4.3, RFC 4271, Section 5.1.3, RFC 2545, Section 3.
aristaBgp4V2NlriNextHopAddr.description: The address of the border router that should be used to access the destination network. This address is the nexthop address received in the UPDATE packet associated with this prefix. Note that for RFC2545 style double nexthops, this object will always contain the global scope nexthop. bgpPathAttrLinkLocalNextHop will contain the linklocal scope nexthop, if it is present. In the case a mechanism is developed to use only a link local nexthop, aristaBgp4V2NlriNextHopAddr will contain the link local nexthop.

aristaBgp4V2NlriLinkLocalNextHopAddrType.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriLinkLocalNextHopAddrType
aristaBgp4V2NlriLinkLocalNextHopAddrType.description: The address type for IPv6 link local addresses. This is present only when receiving RFC 2545 style double nexthops. This object is optionally present in BGP implementations that do not support IPv6. When no IPv6 link local nexthop is present, the value of this object should be unknown(0).

aristaBgp4V2NlriLinkLocalNextHopAddr.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriLinkLocalNextHopAddr
aristaBgp4V2NlriLinkLocalNextHopAddr.description: This value contains an IPv6 link local address and is present only when receiving RFC 2545 style double nexthops. This object is optionally present in BGP implementations that do not support IPv6. When no IPv6 link local nexthop is present, the length of this object should be zero.

aristaBgp4V2NlriLocalPrefPresent.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriLocalPrefPresent
aristaBgp4V2NlriLocalPrefPresent.description: This value is true when the LOCAL_PREF value was sent in the UPDATE message.

aristaBgp4V2NlriLocalPref.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriLocalPref
aristaBgp4V2NlriLocalPref.description: The originating BGP4 speakers degree of preference for an advertised route.

aristaBgp4V2NlriMedPresent.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriMedPresent
aristaBgp4V2NlriMedPresent.description: This value is true when the MED value was sent in the UPDATE message.

aristaBgp4V2NlriMed.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriMed
aristaBgp4V2NlriMed.description: This metric is used to discriminate between multiple exit points to an adjacent autonomous system. When the MED value is absent but has a calculated default value, this object will contain the calculated value.

aristaBgp4V2NlriAtomicAggregate.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriAtomicAggregate
aristaBgp4V2NlriAtomicAggregate.description: This value is true when the ATOMIC_AGGREGATE Path Attribute is present and indicates that the NLRI MUST NOT be made more specific.

aristaBgp4V2NlriAggregatorPresent.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriAggregatorPresent
aristaBgp4V2NlriAggregatorPresent.description: This value is true when the AGGREGATOR path attribute was sent in the UPDATE message.

aristaBgp4V2NlriAggregatorAS.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriAggregatorAS
aristaBgp4V2NlriAggregatorAS.description: The AS number of the last BGP4 speaker that performed route aggregation. When aristaBgp4V2NlriAggregatorPresent is false, the value of this object should be zero (0).

aristaBgp4V2NlriAggregatorAddr.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriAggregatorAddr
aristaBgp4V2NlriAggregatorAddr.description: The IP address of the last BGP4 speaker that performed route aggregation. When aristaBgp4V2NlriAggregatorPresent is false, the value of this object should be 0.0.0.0

aristaBgp4V2NlriAsPathCalcLength.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriAsPathCalcLength
aristaBgp4V2NlriAsPathCalcLength.description: This value represents the calculated length of the AS Path according to the rules of the BGP specification. This value is used in route selection.

aristaBgp4V2NlriAsPathString.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriAsPathString
aristaBgp4V2NlriAsPathString.description: This is a string depicting the autonomous system path to this network which was received from the peer which advertised it. The format of the string is implementation-dependent, and should be designed for operator readability. Note that SnmpAdminString is only capable of representing a maximum of 255 characters. This may lead to the string being truncated in the presence of a large AS Path. It is RECOMMENDED that when this object's contents will be truncated that the final 3 octets be reserved for the ellipses string, '...'. aristaBgp4V2NlriAsPath may give access to the full AS Path.

aristaBgp4V2NlriAsPath.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriAsPath
aristaBgp4V2NlriAsPath.description: In order to provide a canonicalized form of the BGP-4 AS_PATH along with the human-readable aristaBgp4V2NlriAsPathString, which may be truncated, this object contains the contents of the BGP-4 AS_PATH Path Attribute. This object may be parsed using the rules defined for Four-octet ASes as defined in RFC 4893. RFC 4271, Section 4.3, 'Path Attributes: b) AS_PATH' as amended by RFC 5065, Section 3 defines the general format of the AS_PATH path attribute and its code points. In brief, the AS_PATH is composed of a sequence of AS Segments. Each AS Segment is represented by a triple: <path segment type, path segment length, path segment value>. The path segment type and path segment length fields are one octet in length each. The path segment type field may be one of: 1 - AS_SET (RFC 4721, Section 4.3) 2 - AS_SEQUENCE (RFC 4721, Section 4.3) 3 - AS_CONFED_SEQUENCE (RFC 3065, Section 5) 4 - AS_CONFED_SET (RFC 3065, Section 5) The path segment length field contains the number of ASes (not the number of octets) in the path segment value field. The path segment value field contains one or more AS numbers, each encoded as a 4-octet length field in network byte order. Note that since an SNMP agent may truncate this object to less than its maximum theoretical length of 4072 octets users of this object should be prepared to deal with a truncated and thus malformed AS_PATH. It is RECOMMENDED that when such truncation would occur on the boundary of an encoded AS that the partial AS be discarded from this object and the object's size be adjusted accordingly. Further, it is also RECOMMENDED that when such truncation, either alone or in conjuction with the truncation of a partially encoded AS described previously, would yield an empty path segment value field that the path segment type and path segment length components of the truncated AS_PATH also be discarded and the object's size be adjusted accordingly.

aristaBgp4V2NlriPathAttrUnknown.name: aristaBgp4V2NlriPathAttrUnknown
aristaBgp4V2NlriPathAttrUnknown.description: Path Attributes not understood by this implementation SHOULD be be presented in this object. Those Path Attributes use the type, length, value encoding documented in RFC 4271, Section 4.3, 'Path Attributes'. Note that since an SNMP agent may truncate this object to less than its maximum theoretical length of 4072 octets users of this object should be prepared to deal with a truncated and thus malformed Path Attribute.

aristaBgp4V2AdjRibsOutTable.name: aristaBgp4V2AdjRibsOutTable
aristaBgp4V2AdjRibsOutTable.description: This table contains on a per-peer basis one or more routes from the aristaBgp4V2NlriTable that have been placed in this peer's Adj-Ribs-Out.

aristaBgp4V2AdjRibsOutEntry.name: aristaBgp4V2AdjRibsOutEntry
aristaBgp4V2AdjRibsOutEntry.description: List of BGP routes that have been placed into a peer's Adj-Ribs-Out.

aristaBgp4V2AdjRibsOutIndex.name: aristaBgp4V2AdjRibsOutIndex
aristaBgp4V2AdjRibsOutIndex.description: Certain extensions to BGP permit multiple instance of a per afi, per safi prefix to be advertised to a peer. This object allows the enumeration of them.

aristaBgp4V2AdjRibsOutRoute.name: aristaBgp4V2AdjRibsOutRoute
aristaBgp4V2AdjRibsOutRoute.description: This object points to the route in the aristaBgp4V2NlriTable that corresponds to the entry in the peer's Adj-Rib-Out. Outgoing route maps are not reflected at this point as those are part of the Update-Send process.

aristaBgp4V2EstablishedNotification.name: aristaBgp4V2EstablishedNotification
aristaBgp4V2EstablishedNotification.description: The BGP Established event is generated when the BGP FSM enters the established state.

aristaBgp4V2BackwardTransitionNotificati.name: aristaBgp4V2BackwardTransitionNotification
aristaBgp4V2BackwardTransitionNotificati.description: The BGPBackwardTransition Event is generated when the BGP FSM moves from a higher numbered state to a lower numbered state. Due to the nature of the BGP state machine, an implementation MAY rate limit the generation of this event. An implementation MAY also generate this notification ONLY when the state machine moves out of the established state. An implementation should document its specific behavior.

aristaBgp4V2Compliance.name: aristaBgp4V2Compliance
aristaBgp4V2Compliance.description: The compliance statement for entities which implement the BGP4 mib.

aristaBgp4V2GlobalsGroup.name: aristaBgp4V2GlobalsGroup
aristaBgp4V2GlobalsGroup.description: A collection of objects providing information on global BGP state.

aristaBgp4V2StdMIBTimersGroup.name: aristaBgp4V2StdMIBTimersGroup
aristaBgp4V2StdMIBTimersGroup.description: Objects associated with BGP peering timers.

aristaBgp4V2StdMIBCountersGroup.name: aristaBgp4V2StdMIBCountersGroup
aristaBgp4V2StdMIBCountersGroup.description: Objects to count discrete events and exchanges on BGP sessions.

aristaBgp4V2StdMIBErrorsGroup.name: aristaBgp4V2StdMIBErrorsGroup
aristaBgp4V2StdMIBErrorsGroup.description: Errors received on BGP peering sessions.

aristaBgp4V2StdMIBPeerGroup.name: aristaBgp4V2StdMIBPeerGroup
aristaBgp4V2StdMIBPeerGroup.description: Core object types on BGP peering sessions.

aristaBgp4V2StdMIBNlriGroup.name: aristaBgp4V2StdMIBNlriGroup
aristaBgp4V2StdMIBNlriGroup.description: Attributes received on BGP peering sessions.

aristaBgp4V2StdMIBNotificationGroup.name: aristaBgp4V2StdMIBNotificationGroup
aristaBgp4V2StdMIBNotificationGroup.description: Notifications in this modules are completely optional.
